title: MAG 101 - Another Twist Transcript
text:
MAG – 101 – Another Twist 
Content Warnings: 
- Body horror 
- Kidnapping 
- Betrayal 
[The Magnus Archives Theme – Intro] 
JONATHAN SIMS 
Rusty Quill presents: The Magnus Archives. Episode one hundred and one. 
Another Twist. 
[Tape clicks on. The voices echo slightly. There’s a strange background hum.] 
ORSINOV 
(Sing song) Oh, it does work! What have you been recording? Anything 
spooky? 
(The Archivist is gagged. He makes a muffled noise in response.) 
ORSINOV 
Is it… your Elias who listens? Hello! 
(Another gagged response from the Archivist.) 
ORSINOV 
He’s mine now, and you can’t have him back. 

(The Archivist makes a gagged sound that sounds like a question.) 
ORSINOV 
Oh, don’t worry, it’s not for you. You won’t even need a coffin – we’re going to 
use every piece of you. 
(The Archivist makes a noise of exclamation.) 
ORSINOV 
Now could you two please move that thing somewhere far, far away? 
BREEKON 
Not really. 
HOPE 
Needs to be near us. 
ORSINOV 
Well, just… just move yourselves away, and take it with you. 
BREEKON 
Gotcha 
HOPE 
Right you are. 
[They pick up the coffin and leave. The background hum is replaced by the 
sound of rain.] 

ORSINOV 
Right. Where were we? 
(The Archivist makes a noise of indignation.) 
ORSINOV 
Oh, of course! So, Elias, can I call you Elias? Let me set the scene, as I know you 
can’t actually see this. He’s tied to a chair – Sarah wanted to use nails, but I 
talked her out of it because I’m a good friend. You’re welcome. And he is 
absolutely surrounded with waxworks. Not… good waxworks, though. Weird 
ones. Wax faces where you feel like you almost recognise who it’s meant to be, 
but, then instead... ah, it’s downright uncanny! 
(The Archivist makes more noises of indignation.) 
ORSINOV 
Excuse me! I’m talking to your boss, and I would thank you not to interrupt. 
(The Archivist continues to make muffled protests) 
You know, I must say Elias, can I call you Elias? You have not raised this one 
very well. 
(More muffled noises from The Archivist.) 
ORSINOV 
He is rude. And he just will not stop asking questions. Ooh, but now, I can ask 
the questions! How are you feeling? 
(More muffled noises from The Archivist.) 

ORSINOV 
Oh wonderful. Now, about the whole skin thing… You see, originally, I was just 
planning to have you followed, in case you found that ancient relic one. I 
mean, my goodness, it is very powerful. And if you didn’t come through, well, 
you’re quite powerful yourself, and more than that, you are… symbolically 
appropriate (chuckles) so I thought you'd make a lovely frock! 
(The Archivist’s muffled noises sounds more panicked.) 
ORSINOV 
Exactly! And, well, I was going to wait, but… y’know, have you ever had one of 
those backup plans that, when you think about it, they’re, they’re just more 
fun? So I thought, out with the old, in with… well, in with the you! 
(More panicked noises from the Archivist.) 
ORSINOV 
Oh, no, I’m afraid he can’t See you, can you Elias, can I call you Elias? What’s 
the point of having a secret place of power if you can’t hide it from a big, 
stupid eye? Anyway, you sit tight. Lots to do! Ooh, also, do you have preferred 
brand of lotion? Because you have not been taking care of your skin, and we 
really do need it in better shape before we peel you. 
(The Archivist makes an indignant noise through the gag.) 
ORSINOV 
Alright, I’ll just ask them to pick up a selection. 
[Footsteps. A door closes] 

(The Archivist takes several deep breaths.) 
[Tape clicks off. Tape clicks on. It’s still raining.] 
(The Archivist’s breathing is still audible.) 
[There is a strange laughter. A different door opens.] 
MICHAEL 
Oh… Oh…. Oh, Archivist. What have you done now? It’s almost sad to see you 
like this. 
(The Archivist groans.) 
MICHAEL 
Almost. I’ve come to a decision, Archivist. I’m going to kill you. 
(The Archivist makes a noise of frustration.) 
MICHAEL 
It’s earlier than I had hoped, but that’s life… I suppose. Your life. [Giggles] 
Before I do, however, I want you to understand… even if it does go against my 
nature. So. 
(The Archivist gasps as the gag is taken off.) 
MICHAEL 
(Slowly, deliberately.) Ask your questions. 
ARCHIVIST 
What?
